Description: Sixteen joining sherds (together with those listed under 'Comment') of lip and wall of Corinthian black-figured kylix with handle root; lip preserved on 1924,1201.1199 and 1200. Interior: tongues between bands on lip; slight remains of glaze on wall; band, perhaps in reserved tondo, at bottom. Exterior, from top: staggered zig-zags between bands on rim; on wall, band at turn to lip; two friezes separated by double lines; above: rear part of horse to left, overlapping handle root, and lion and griffin or sphinx to right; below: lion confronting browsing goat; rays above glazed area, with probable added colour lines, on lower wall.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.089) (Phase 1)
